Today is International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women. Our latest #IMFBlog features new research showing how domestic abuse can make economies less prosperous. https://t.co/PG2h81wkNt

#GenerationEquality #OrangeTheWorld https://t.co/X7ZlWazUmz
How trade liberalization can help reignite Asia’s traditional economic growth engine ➡️ https://t.co/pC6aGnVox8 #IMFBlog https://t.co/40ncVfS31W
Professor @jrockstrom spoke to @KGeorgieva at the #StatsForum about the urgent need for good #climate data. https://t.co/b8adFuZMJm

The IMF completed the first review of #Ukraine’s economic performance under the 18-month Stand-By Arrangement (SBA). See the main takeaways and the staff report here: https://t.co/Oo9b8XzcDw https://t.co/JPukWqMBkg

In a recent IMF event discussing the latest economic outlook for the Middle East and North Africa region, the IMF’s Jihad Azour shared how the region could benefit from the recent SDR Allocations.
https://t.co/NV8GzSjx2I https://t.co/p80Jf5b8ov

How do people think about the economy? JOIN US November 30, 9:30 AM (ET) for the Seventh Richard Goode Lecture @S_Stantcheva, will exchange views with @Kgeorgieva. Submit your Q’s beforehand via FADRG@imf.org.
https://t.co/6Uu2Irle0Q https://t.co/3sWnjI2g1x

Last week, @KGeorgieva spoke with @jrockstrom about work at the IMF to integrate #climate and macroeconomic data, because good data means better policies and more accountability for results. #StatsForum https://t.co/VrsrGQC1oE

🇩🇿 Algeria’s economy was hit hard by the pandemic and the drop in oil prices in 2020. A recovery is underway, helped by the government response. Policies need to target a new growth model for the economy.
📰 Read our latest press release to learn more: https://t.co/8iNIyYtMRj https://t.co/SmRaSAH93N

JOIN US November 30, 9:30 AM (ET) for the Seventh Richard Goode Lecture: “How do people think about the economy?”

Presented by @Harvard Professor @S_Stantcheva, the lecture will explore the role of individual perceptions in decision-making and politics.  
https://t.co/iyuIyYUgFi https://t.co/OvTWJdl323

Economic forecasts are our best guesses for how economic variables like employment or inflation will evolve going forward. Want to know more about economic forecasting? Watch this video. https://t.co/2MGXct5CVk

New! The IMF and @wto launch a database designed to track the production and delivery of COVID-19 vaccines. Learn more about the WTO-IMF Vaccine Trade Tracker here: https://t.co/TTNmoO6qQl https://t.co/1lXL5Yhwwi

Want regular updates on the IMF’s work in the #MiddleEast and North #Africa delivered straight to your inbox? Tap here to subscribe to our monthly newsletter—MENA Update: https://t.co/wvsPOHxQiR. https://t.co/pAHg68PLI0

This Chart of the Week illustrates how global supply chain disruptions have led to longer delivery times and examines the prospects for the future. https://t.co/2V9HYq8CfY #IMFBlog https://t.co/uMWnTwinvx

The global recovery continues, but momentum has weakened, hobbled by the pandemic. Risks to economic prospects have increased, and policy trade-offs have become more complex. https://t.co/j0FIiCr9li #WEO https://t.co/Xf2YBebXs8

Reducing trade restrictions has historically meant more growth, investment, and productivity – a lesson for Asia as the region works to support its recovery from the pandemic. #IMFblog https://t.co/pC6aGocZVI https://t.co/B1wRg13sQQ

Did you miss our recent panel on how technology such as #bigdata, data mining, #blockchain, and other digital innovations can help improve governance and fight #corruption? Watch it here: https://t.co/aw5Y8QMkUv https://t.co/iMMiLzdeEO

Clean energy needs under a net-zero emissions scenario may send copper, nickel, cobalt, and lithium prices soaring through the end of this decade – which could derail or delay the clean energy transition itself. Our #IMFblog explains. https://t.co/OmUIEMuNB4 https://t.co/Jv76igBJxz
Will central bank digital currencies (#CBDCs) improve the stability of the international monetary and financial system? Watch the discussion: https://t.co/IWoDO4QA2k https://t.co/aAWSdcnRR4
The COVID-19 pandemic reversed years of gains in women’s #FinancialInclusion in some countries. Learn more in our latest Financial Access Survey. https://t.co/uFsRzAb8PQ https://t.co/nSBESZemG0

The Chinese 🇨🇳 economy continues its recovery, but momentum is slowing. Supportive economic policies, financial stability, and structural reforms are key to protect the recovery and sustain high-quality growth in the long run. https://t.co/62Kqqs5gDY #China https://t.co/1aTm7TWRZ2

What are the policy priorities at this stage of the European recovery from the pandemic? At #EBS2021 Alfred Kammer pointed to global vaccination, careful handling of crisis exit, as well as focus on green and digital transformation: https://t.co/11yYMfnGTW https://t.co/ZYIuznko5f

Dementia is poised to slow economic growth and undermine global health and economic equity, unless nations act now, according to authors of a new #FandD article: https://t.co/6BQcxMrctZ #LausanneVIII https://t.co/vsmZIvR34R

IMF’s Deputy MD Li at #StatsForum: There is an urgent need to strengthen the #climate information architecture. A harmonized, timely, and reliable set of data can help unlock climate action by both the public and private sector. Read his full remarks: https://t.co/xVzmb5FoWZ https://t.co/e5D1MdWK1e

IMF’s Kammer at #EMPL: Workers will need to upskill through life-long learning to cope with a new normal where disruption will be more the norm than the exception.

Full presentation here: https://t.co/qCEDbxLUBR https://t.co/R5kjWeCRo2
Live Now: One-on-One Discussion between Professor @jrockstrom and IMF Managing Director @KGeorgieva at the 9th IMF #StatsForum https://t.co/ctYEVJkxoj #StatsForum https://t.co/AJacyhG8ew

Robots can bring strong economic growth but also feed rising inequality. Our latest #IMFBlog explores the tradeoffs governments can consider in spending and tax policies to help workers. https://t.co/IFFwKgQJRN https://t.co/yX2azfjYjP

At #EBS2021 Alfred Kammer stressed that fiscal space should be rebuilt gradually after the pandemic is reined in and a robust economic recovery is in place, to be ready to respond to future shocks and crises: https://t.co/11yYMfnGTW https://t.co/oYHRU2MLVI
Inflation has surged in Latin America’s largest economies. What’s driving it? Find out on #IMFBlog. https://t.co/mr4coLiyrj https://t.co/VqMC9Erzra

Live Now: Climate Change and Statistics—The Road Ahead w/ @miaamormottley, @jimstockmetrics, @BrookingInst’s Amar Bhattacharya, @BlackRock’s Eric Van Nostrand, and Kristina Kostial. Moderated by @FT’s @gilliantett. https://t.co/ctYEVJkxoj #StatsForum https://t.co/69R8pwhADJ

Have you heard? Our latest newsletter gives you a curated look at latest IMF news and research on the Middle East and North Africa each month. 
➡️Subscribe today at https://t.co/wvsPOHxQiR https://t.co/8fWLEUSvpv

Live Now: Panel discussion on international efforts to measure #ClimateChange with @OECD @WorldBank @IEA @EIB and @UNStats, moderated by IMF Chief Statistician and Data Officer Louis Marc Ducharme. https://t.co/ctYEVJkxoj #StatsForum https://t.co/dJkOE4YWq1
Explore the IMF's #Climate Change Indicators Dashboard: a statistical tool linking climate considerations and global economic indicators https://t.co/lAVprRM4b8 #StatsForum https://t.co/69JdekqNy1

Live Now: IMF’s Gabriel Quirós-Romero presents our Climate Change Indicators Dashboard, a platform that provides #climatedata for macroeconomic and financial stability analysis. https://t.co/ctYEVJkxoj #StatsForum https://t.co/dJkOE4YWq1

Across the Arab World, small businesses, low-income workers, women, migrants, and young people are falling further behind. Policymakers can build a more resilient, inclusive, and greener recovery. Click here to learn how: https://t.co/dEstlOgq9f https://t.co/Riixdfpz4W

What are the key issues in measuring climate change in macroeconomic statistics? Join us tomorrow, Thursday at 9:30am ET for a panel discussion with IMF Chief Statistician and Data Officer Louis Marc Ducharme.  https://t.co/ctYEVJC8MT #StatsForum https://t.co/dJkOE4Hlyt
IMF Staff concluded today preliminary discussions with 🇰🇿 Kazakhstan's authorities on the annual review of the country’s economy. Read more here: https://t.co/LApdZ0koXA https://t.co/BoFHklx2tp

Where are the climate-related data gaps? How can better data help track progress towards a greener & more sustainable global economy? Tune in Thursday, November 18 at 1:30pm ET for a discussion with @FT’s @gilliantett. https://t.co/ctYEVJC8MT #StatsForum https://t.co/69R8pvZZMb

Tune in today and tomorrow, November 17-18, for a series of conversations on #climate data from this year's #StatsForum, including a one-on-one discussion between @KGeorgieva and @PIK_Climate Director @jrockstrom. 

Watch here: https://t.co/ctYEVJC8MT https://t.co/1hNtGD01TF

Arab countries continue to face an uneven recovery. Managing Director @KGeorgieva spoke about how policymakers can build a more resilient, inclusive, and greener recovery at the 2021 #ArabFiscalForum w/ the Arab Monetary Fund. Read her full remarks here: https://t.co/0NJPRtjutU https://t.co/TZmlSK9ORM

Nigeria’s eNaira is the world’s second central bank digital currency fully open to the public, after the Bahamas. Find out more about this significant step in the digital money revolution in our latest #IMFCountryFocus: https://t.co/kydxjFfYvu #IMFAfrica https://t.co/mpkGL5UxA7

@KGeorgieva @PIK_Climate @jrockstrom Join us Thursday, Nov. 18 at 9am ET for a showcase of the IMF’s new #ClimateChange Indicators Dashboard, a platform that provides climate data for macroeconomic and financial stability analysis. #StatsForum https://t.co/ctYEVJC8MT https://t.co/dJkOE4Hlyt
Inflation has surged in Latin America’s largest economies. What’s driving it? Find out in our latest #IMFBlog #ChartOfTheWeek https://t.co/mr4coLiyrj https://t.co/A2RlbLX820

At the #EBS2021, Alfred Kammer will discuss the future of the European economy and the recovery from the pandemic. Tune in on November 18th, 5:40AM ET / 11:40AM CET. 

Register here: https://t.co/bc8FKOUwei https://t.co/HgDMVuusFF
Have you seen our latest economic outlook for the Middle East and North Africa region? Here’s a quick summary by @BeckyCNN. https://t.co/1Qwtg2s6hT https://t.co/LmSCxaf0Qo

Join us Thursday, November 18 for a series of events from our 9th #StatsForum, including a one-on-one discussion between @KGeorgieva and @PIK_Climate Director @jrockstrom at 3:15pm ET.  https://t.co/ctYEVJC8MT https://t.co/AJacyhXJD6

The pandemic has made the richest households richer. In the US, net wealth for the top 1% rose seven-fold more than households in the bottom 50%. https://t.co/bZANX2WVfV #IMFBlog https://t.co/kgLqcIi7TR

#India’s 🇮🇳 fiscal, monetary, and health responses to the #pandemic are supporting its recovery and, along with economic reforms, helping to prevent a longer-lasting adverse impact of the crisis, according to the latest annual review by IMF staff. https://t.co/NZz5cy0ejI https://t.co/M2MbeZfXvO

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath summarizes the main findings of the World Economic Outlook, the risks facing the world, and our policy recommendations. https://t.co/KnxQBjiK2u #WEO https://t.co/0N6HuGn2wN

Measuring Climate Change: this year’s #StatsForum takes place on November 17-18. Follow a series of conversations on climate data, including a one-on-one discussion between @KGeorgieva and @PIK_Climate Director @jrockstrom. https://t.co/ctYEVJC8MT https://t.co/aRTEnZ17Xs

The global recovery continues, but momentum has weakened, hobbled by the pandemic. Risks to economic prospects have increased, and policy trade-offs have become more complex. https://t.co/j0FIiCr9li #WEO https://t.co/MId3yY022i
#India is forecast to enjoy one of the fastest expansions of any major economy this year and next, boosting prospects for Asia. https://t.co/NZz5cxIDsa #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/M7G0r6t3tN

The slow rollout of vaccines in sub-Saharan Africa is a key reason why the region’s recovery is slower than the rest of the world. A new IMF Country Focus tells the story of the region’s outlook in seven charts. https://t.co/cxB13QdadL #IMFAfrica https://t.co/UqcIQXzwKp
.@GitaGopinath and @ChicagoBooth's Raghuram Rajan discuss #inflation in the latest @imf_podcast. https://t.co/5j1SHb75nd

A transition to a green economy can deliver on the Paris Climate Agreement and create economic opportunity – but only if governments act now, decisively, together. #COP26 https://t.co/Rkm1YCAuUw https://t.co/eQPiamOgrX

This year, the @ParisPeaceForum showcases 80 projects, including @imfcapdev’s online course on Inclusive Growth. Sign-up to learn how countries can foster strong economic growth while also sharing its benefits equitably.
https://t.co/8L8hWZWQje #ParisPeaceForum2021 https://t.co/iNYA7YMdyi
What are three things we should keep in mind while the global recovery continues? @KGeorgieva at the #ParisPeaceForum2021 #SolutionsforPeace: https://t.co/ljsImO31MA https://t.co/HyA4vh9o8N

#India 🇮🇳 is forecast to enjoy one of the fastest expansions of any major economy this year and next, boosting prospects for Asia. Check out our #infographic to learn more. https://t.co/NZz5cy0ejI https://t.co/dx8EWm949r

.@KGeorgieva highlights 3 gaps during the global recovery:
 
1️⃣ Economic divergence between and within countries
2️⃣ Unequal access to vaccines
3️⃣ Unequal fiscal support

▶️ https://t.co/dx6v2paVLj #ParisPeaceForum2021 https://t.co/rH9vkfXVw6

How can global principles on data—agreed to by all countries—help level the playing field and address financial stability and inclusion, competition, and privacy? Our latest #IMFBlog explains https://t.co/IztTFTewOn https://t.co/5dRvf6FBCS

Per capita incomes in Mexico continue to diverge from those in the US, a trend that began before the pandemic. Learn more about the latest projections in our #IMFCountryFocus #infographic. https://t.co/NmEq9cm6jX https://t.co/y19UbPtXHt

How can we better measure the economic impact of #ClimateChange? This year’s #StatsForum will address some of the most pressing issues in gathering climate-related data. Join the conversation November 17-18. https://t.co/ctYEVJC8MT https://t.co/IiLG0YDslu
#India’s growth is poised for a rebound, one of the fastest of all major economies, after a second wave of #COVID19 infections this year. https://t.co/NZz5cy0ejI https://t.co/v9mH1OsVpe

Learn how the IMF is supporting its member countries with a new fiscal risk toolkit that helps to ensure sound public finances, macroeconomic stability, and fiscal transparency.  https://t.co/g3y8dR0b8Y https://t.co/jAGZi2pHe4

At the #ParisPeaceForum2021, @KGeorgieva outlined the most effective options for the path to global recovery. See the statement on SDR rechanneling here: https://t.co/tT1frof4d9 https://t.co/6fp3Z5XPW9

The 2021 edition of the @ParisPeaceForum showcases the @imfcapdev project on "Capacity for Inclusive Growth amidst COVID-19", featuring our online course on inclusive growth. Find out more at: https://t.co/8L8hWZWQje https://t.co/Ys08FmCGeA
Our latest #IMFblog explains why soaring metal prices may be bad news for our transition to more sustainable energy sources. https://t.co/OmUIEMMoZE https://t.co/DkcyoGEW38

STARTING NOW: A panel discussion on the pandemic's legacy on firms and workers in the Middle East and North Africa.
@Economyae @_HadleyGamble @amazon @ERFlatest @iloarabstates @CNBCi https://t.co/A7Sj70WjtE

.@KGeorgieva will discuss the recovery from the pandemic at the #ParisPeaceForum2021. How can the IMF’s Special Drawing Rights become a useful tool for all? Learn tomorrow at 9:45AM ET https://t.co/USmcWxnSMK. #SolutionsforPeace https://t.co/ZKGDoGh93i

How can data help policymakers better address climate issues? What data are available and what are the key data gaps? Join us November 17-18 for our 9th #StatsForum: Measuring #ClimateChange. https://t.co/ctYEVJC8MT https://t.co/w15TC2aF9h
How can #Mexico boost inclusive growth and raise productivity? Find out in our latest #IMFCountryFocus story. https://t.co/NmEq9cm6jX https://t.co/Hxp7JcKnFb

Deputy Managing Director Bo Li today urged policymakers to harness the benefits that technology can bring to the financial system while proactively addressing the risks it may bring. Read more in his remarks. https://t.co/n295CPZkS5 #fintech https://t.co/hZzbvcP8H3
🔴 LIVE: A conversation with international experts in data finance, governance, and cyber risks on managing technology in finance. https://t.co/B1AYsrVbT5 #fintech https://t.co/UkTbdJmWmM
To improve transparency, the new IMF-WHO Vaccine Supply Forecast Dashboard provides visibility of delivery schedules, especially for donated doses. Explore the tracker here: https://t.co/Lb6Q7bgoHO

They also called on the #G20 to join efforts to meet the vaccination target of 40% by end-2021 by:
1. Allow manufacturers to prioritize COVAX & AVAT
2. Streamline donations to COVAX & pledge more
3. Explore effective vaccine swaps
4. Eliminate vaccine-related export restrictions

The heads of the IMF, @WorldBank, @WTO & @WHO met with the CEOs of leading COVID-19 vaccine manufacturing companies to discuss urgent steps to deliver more vaccine doses to low-income countries. More in the press release. https://t.co/zITCCc1MIv https://t.co/BHFkb9Vthw

The richest households grew richer during the pandemic driven by a boom in the value of their investments and housing prices.

Our new Chart of the Week shows the top 1% accumulated even more wealth during the pandemic compared to the few years before. https://t.co/bZANX3ew7t https://t.co/crclNSQaWc

Today at #COP26 the focus is on women and girls. To learn more about our work on gender and economics, check out the latest data and analysis #IMFGender: https://t.co/fsumVqt85y https://t.co/2mvy1tIdbG

The pandemic has made the richest households richer. In the US, net wealth for the top 1% rose seven-fold more than households in the bottom 50%. Read more in our latest Chart of the Week: https://t.co/bZANX3ew7t #IMFBlog https://t.co/mTypPSEVdi

#Mexico’s 🇲🇽 economy is on the rebound but raising productivity and tackling poverty remain key challenges. Read more about how Mexico can tackle these challenges in our latest #IMFCountryFocus infographic. https://t.co/NmEq9cm6jX https://t.co/Z17ALAsSZo

The number one priority for sub-Saharan Africa’s economic recovery is exiting the pandemic. And for this to happen, there must be international cooperation on vaccination to reach the global targets. https://t.co/nPhQ7iy9BU #IMFAfrica https://t.co/RT2EuVREjP

LIVE: Kristalina Georgieva discusses the evolving nature of the EU budget with Johannes Hahn, Commissioner for Budget and Administration of the European Commission and Sam Fleming, Brussels Bureau Chief at the Financial Times. https://t.co/ysrlVdnbTj

#Finland is leading the way in replacing fossil-based chemicals with renewable raw materials like wood. Read more in our latest #IMFCountryFocus. #COP26 https://t.co/OxuqQM2faK https://t.co/mdoejHNA2G

For 15 resource-intensive economies in sub-Saharan Africa, revenue from mining accounts for just 2% of GDP on average. 

New IMF research finds that many countries are losing out on collecting their fair share of taxes: https://t.co/ahdCSUkR8y #IMFAfrica #IMFBlog https://t.co/M88TzBrx6f

TOMORROW: Tune in to @KGeorgieva’s discussion on the challenges ahead and policy ambition for the EU budget with @Sam1Fleming of @ftbrussels and @JHahnEU of the @EU_Commission. 

🔗 https://t.co/5acf8Yjp3b

The island nation of #Dominica, home to some of the Caribbean’s most breathtaking natural beauty, lies smack in the middle of Hurricane Alley. Learn more about how the country is building resilience: https://t.co/su7Pjv0MTo #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/FXwZYcuLRI

REPLAY: #ARCPolak conversation between @GitaGopinath and @ChicagoBooth's Raghuram Rajan on vaccines, the recovery, and policy responses in advanced economies and emerging markets. https://t.co/93YDSN4Cii https://t.co/ykrbZiH7t2

Mining is critical to many sub-Saharan African economies, but tax strategies used by multinational firms prevents many governments from collecting their fair share of tax revenue. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog about policies to counter this trend: https://t.co/zRcsbjj4xx https://t.co/AmNwInnVkY

#Finland was the first country to introduce a #carbon tax. It’s now finding new, sustainable ways to use wood and bio-based materials instead of plastics, concrete, and steel. #COP26 Our latest #IMFCountryFocus has more: https://t.co/OxuqQM2faK https://t.co/9hgojNx9AR

#Dominica is on a path to become the world's first nation resilient to hurricanes, earthquakes, and other natural disasters. Read more in #IMFCountryFocus: https://t.co/su7Pjv0MTo https://t.co/8iJ4dMRaT9
